title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=f975f1c3093a3d9598a1da39854b03d1250bd55d
comments: Suggest indie games for 30 year old unkill, folks, and the game should be able to run on amd ryzen on board graphic card üôÅ
Factorio, amazing game, I can just put in hours and hours in it. Don't let the pixelated screenshots fool you into dropping it.
Limbo, Inside, Bastion, Gris, Transistor, The Swapper... check this out. Most of these aren't demanding on graphics and super fun to play.
I love pixelated games and I have 300+ hours in stardew valley. Thanks for the suggestion mate.
Thanks for suggesting. Limbo was really good. I would look into the other games suggested.

Just played some Call of duty Mobile BR; returned to it after a month long break, so much fun dude

I just want Warzone mobile to release already, I'm so hyped
I cannot recommend Hades enough. Amazing band-drawn graphics, tight gameplay, and a story that‚Äôs to die for (you‚Äôll know when you play it). Supergiant‚Äôs best work after Transistor
Thanks, with two recommendations, can't wait to try out this game this weekend
Slay the Spire can run on a potato, it has high replayability some people I know already sink in 1000 hours for that game

Hello everyone!

I am learning game development using Unreal Engine 5. As of now I can make endless runners for android. 

What desi twist do you want as an Indian audience that I should work on as my first project?
I lost interest after few deaths as it basically felt like repeating everything. Was I wrong to quit early?

I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs a good game to stick with, especially once you unlock the different weapons that change the gameplay. And with every run, you get stronger, and soon you‚Äôre beating bosses for fun while inching your way towards esacpe. The story that unfolds on the way is a lot of fun too - the real work of art is how a game that‚Äôs an endless loop of death builds such an amazing narrative
Thank you. I will give it another go then :)
